Then said the Lord to me, Go yet, and love a woman (beloved of her husband, and was an harlot) according to the love of the Lord toward the children of Israel: yet they looked to other gods, and loved the wine bottles.
So I bought her to me for fifteen pieces of silver, and for an homer of barley, and an half homer of barley.
And I said unto her, Thou shalt abide with me many days: thou shalt not play the harlot, and thou shalt be to none other man, and I will be so unto thee.
For the children of Israel shall remain many days without a king and without a prince, and without an offering, and without an image, and without an Ephod, and without Teraphim.
Afterward shall the children of Israel convert and seek the Lord their God, and David their king, and shall fear the Lord and his goodness in the latter days.
